treatment.reference: Methanococcus igneus sp. nov., a novel hyperthermophilic methanogen from a shallow submarine hydrothermal system Syst Appl Microbiol 13:263-269
treatment.description: Cells are irregular cocci about 1.3-1.8 µm in width. Many pairs are formed during exponential growth phase. Cell envelope consisting of protein subunits (S-layer). Cells are immotile and no tufts of flagella visible. Convex pale yellow round smooth colonies formed on agar. Growth between 45 and 91˚C (optimum: 88˚C) and between 0.45 and 7.2% salt (optimum: 1.8%). pH range of growth between 5 and 7.5 (optimum: 5.7). Strictly anaerobic, obligately chemolithoautotrophic. Formation of methane from H2 and CO2. No stimulation of growth by Na2SeO4 or by yeast extract or peptone. S˚ inhibitory to growth. H2S formed from H2 and S˚. The DNA base composition is 31 mol % GC. Isolated from a shallow submarine hydrothermal vent system at the Kolbeinsey rise situated on the Mid Atlantic Ridge north off Iceland, at a depth of 106 m. Type strain is Methanococcus igneus Kol 5 = DSM 5666, Braunschweig, FRG.
